intro: Socratea albolineata, commonly known as the white-line socratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate leaves. The plant is notable for its unique white, waxy lines that run along the trunk, giving it its common name. Socratea albolineata is a slow-growing species that can reach heights of up to 20 meters in its natural habitat. It plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
